intro: Bunias cornuta, commonly known as the horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, horn-shaped seed pods. The plant features showy, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a hairy texture. Bunias cornuta is typically found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils.
